results.title: Simvastatin potentiates the cell-killing activity of imatinib in imatinib-resistant chronic myeloid leukemia cells mainly through PI3K/AKT pathway attenuation and Myc downregulation.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ potentiates the cell-killing activity of @CHEMICAL_Imatinib_Mesylate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068877 @@@imatinib@@@ in @CHEMICAL_Imatinib_Mesylate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068877 @@@imatinib@@@-resistant @<m>DISEASE_Leukemia_Myelogenous_Chronic_BCR_ABL_Positive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015464 @@@chronic myeloid leukemia@@@ cells mainly through PI3K/@GENE_AKT1 @GENE_207 @@@AKT@@@ pathway attenuation and @GENE_MYC @GENE_4609 @@@Myc@@@ downregulation.

results.title: In vitro and in vivo study of cell growth inhibition of simvastatin on chronic myelogenous leukemia cells.

results.title: Combination of simvastatin and imatinib sensitizes the CD34+ cells in K562 to cell death.
results.text_hl: Our data here point out that combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Imatinib_Mesylate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068877 @@@imatinib@@@ could be a therapeutic option for the resistant @<m>DISEASE_Leukemia_Myelogenous_Chronic_BCR_ABL_Positive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015464 @@@CML@@@.

results.title: Synergistic killing effect of imatinib and simvastatin on imatinib-resistant chronic myelogenous leukemia cells.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ also killed primary CD34 cells from @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Leukemia_Myelogenous_Chronic_BCR_ABL_Positive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015464 @@@CML@@@ more efficiently, compared with CD34 @<m>DISEASE_Leukemia_Myelogenous_Chronic_BCR_ABL_Positive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015464 @@@CML@@@ cells.
